alert.note: Alert for Eastern Walsh County; Grand Forks; Pembina; Steele; Traill (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 11 at 12:47PM CST until March 11 at 4:00PM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CST SATURDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, blowing snow. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Minnesota and northeast and southeast North Dakota. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 4 PM CST this afternoon. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 10 AM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas. Use caution while outside. Wear appropriate winter clothing. The latest road conditions for North Dakota can be found at dot.nd.gov/travel and for Minnesota at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1 in either state.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Walsh County; Grand Forks; Pembina; Steele; Traill
